definition: house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: Does the room rate include breakfast?
Please charge it to my room.
sentences.chinese: 请将费用算到我的房费中。

sentences.english: USD a night at some 3 star hotels of far lesser quality.
sentences.chinese: 高达180美元一晚的房费但质量却大打折扣。

sentences.english: After a couple of minutes of hunting around I realised that there were no details on room rates (well, I couldn't find any).
sentences.chinese: 找了几分钟之后我发现没有关于房费的信息。

sentences.english: All room charges should be pre-paid before check-in.
sentences.chinese: 所有房费须在客人抵店前预付酒店。

sentences.english: Certainly, but you will have to pay for it as usual.
sentences.chinese: 可以，不过您在这期间要照付房费。

sentences.english: Operate the computer to audit special room rates.
sentences.chinese: 操作电脑过房费及交易审核。

sentences.english: Registering with the Hotel and all room and incidental expenses will be paid upon check-out.
sentences.chinese: 所有的房费和杂费会在我退房时付清。

definition: rent for a room or house
hotel room with one double (or queen or king) bed
abbr. for 標準間|标准间[biao1 zhun3 jian1], standard (hotel) room
standard (hotel) room/two-person room of standard size and amenities/abbr. to 标间
to check out of a hotel room
